Event.name: Appeal
Event.definition: <def-root>In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the <fen>Convict</fen> or his or her <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher <fen>Court</fen> to reverse the <fen>Decision</fen> of the lower court on certain <fen>Grounds</fen>. <ex> <fex name="Representative">The defense</fex> plans to <t>appeal</t> <fex name="Decision">the court's decision</fex> <fex name="Grounds">on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b</fex> . </ex> <ex> <fex name="Convict">John Michaels</fex> will <t>appeal</t> <fex name="Decision">his conviction</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Convict
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.</def-root>

Arg.name: Representative
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Decision
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.</def-root>

Arg.name: Grounds
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the legal basis on which the appeal rests.</def-root>

Arg.name: Court
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Court</fen> is the judicial establishment to which the <fen>Convict</fen> appeals.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: appeal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an application to a higher court for a decision to be reversed.

lexUnit.name: appeal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: apply to a higher court for a reversal of the decision of a lower court.

lexUnit.name: appellate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a court) dealing with appeals.

lexUnit.name: appellant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who appeals against a court ruling.
